page.title: 07FARMHOUSE LIFE AT PULHAM
page.content: One Farmer & his wife live in a 17th century farmhouse with a dog & 2 cats; their unmarried son & daughter living locally.All own cars plus 1 motorbike. The kitchen,used for eating & living has a deepfreeze,fridge,washing machine & dishwasher.The water is heated & all cooking done on the AGA burner.This is constantly alight, filled twice daily with solid fuel. Furniture is 2nd hand or antique,some handed down the family. The farmer's wife shops locally, preparing wholesome low fat,high fibre meals using some meat,fish,eggs,cheese & plenty of fruit & vegetables imaginatively prepared. She is a painter & printer.Sings in 3 choirs & fits all this around her family's needs sometimes travelling great distances to take part in exhibitions & musical events.
